intro: Romulea monticola, commonly known as the mountain romulea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related plants. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Romulea monticola is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
